definition: to pull up by the roots/to uproot
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: God is dead, which uproots your life.
sentences.chinese: 上帝死了，你被连根拔起。

sentences.english: The dead tree decomposed and had to be uprooted.
sentences.chinese: 枯死的树腐烂了，只好被连根拔掉。

sentences.english: Water collected in the pit left when the old trees were uprooted.
sentences.chinese: 老树被连根拔起后留下的坑会积水。

sentences.english: Hoes are great gardening tools for chopping up weeds and uprooting plants.
sentences.chinese: 锄头是砍杂草和植物连根拔起大园艺工具。

sentences.english: She 21)clutches at her head to stop the maid from pulling it out by the roots.
sentences.chinese: 女子抓住头以防头发给侍女连根拔出。

sentences.english: We shall have to get the grass up by its roots so that it can't grow again.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该把这棵草连根拔起，这样它才不能再生长了。

sentences.english: He was glad to find the garden unrooted out.
sentences.chinese: 他很高兴发现园中的花木未被连根拔起。

sentences.english: The tree is uprooted by the wind.
Putting forth a great effort,he uprooted the tree.
sentences.chinese: 他使出了很大的劲，把那棵树连根拔起。

sentences.english: In Zhoukou, Henan Province, dozens of trees were uprooted and ripped apart by the strong storms.
sentences.chinese: 河南周口也遭遇特大冰雹，树木被连根拔起。

sentences.english: My big trees were plucked up by the storm last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜那阵狂风暴雨把许多大树连根拔了起来。

sentences.english: The root of Kush I tore up out of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 我将库什的根基从埃及连根拔起。

sentences.english: So, I forced a pull weeds and swept away together.
sentences.chinese: 于是，我用力一拔，杂草连根拔了起来。

sentences.english: Uprooted trees lie on the shores of Cape Romain National Wildlife Refuge.
sentences.chinese: 连根拔起的大树躺在国家动物保护区的沙滩上。

sentences.english: The strong wind uprooted many trees in the park.
sentences.chinese: 风很猛，把公园里的许多树木连根拔起。

sentences.english: Charles’s goal, as Doherty described it, was to tear the government “out at the root.”
sentences.chinese: 据多尔蒂描述，查理斯的目标是将政府“连根拔起”。

definition: at the base/at the root/(of a leg) just below the crutch
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
to pluck/to pull off/to pull out/to unplug
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
